current.title: Community health education
current.body: Six-month courses led by local educators and visiting health professionals. Topics include hygiene and sanitation, nutrition and cooking, wound care, first aid, and women’s health.
current.alt: Women’s health education session with community members in Chicacao, Guatemala.

current.title: Clean water access
current.body: In partnership with Ecofiltros, we provide affordable ceramic water filters and hands‑on training in setup, maintenance, and safe storage so families can drink safely every day.
current.alt: Family receives a ceramic Ecofiltro water filter and bucket for clean drinking water, Chicacao, Guatemala.

current.title: Medical jornadas
current.body: Mobile clinics bring primary care to several communities in the Chicacao region, staffed by Guatemalan providers with support from clinicians in the United States. We focus on patient education, prevention, and rapid connection to local services.
current.alt: Nurse speaking with an elder during a mobile clinic in Chicacao, Guatemala.

current.title: Midwife training
current.body: With local ministries of health we strengthen midwifery skills using Laerdal’s Helping Babies Survive curriculum to improve outcomes for mothers and newborns.
current.alt: Local and visiting healthcare team group portrait in a clinic, Chicacao, Guatemala.
